body.p: Individual sensory neurons that are in proximity to each other are bundled together into nerves that enter the spinal cord through its posterior root or horn. The region of the skin that each spinal nerve carries information from is called its dermatome. Because there are 31 spinal nerves, there are an equal number of dermatomes, each named for the spinal nerve to which it sends information.

caption.p: Dermatomes. By Mikael Haggstrom (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dermatome_(anatomy) Public Domain.

body.p: A dermatome map is particularly useful in the diagnosis of spinal cord injuries that interrupt spinal cord transmission. An injured person will lose sensation from all their dermatomes below the level of injury.
